intro: Hieracium ostreolepium, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the genus Hieracium. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowering period occurs during the summer months. Hieracium ostreolepium is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
